question: Which of the following HTML tag is the special formatting tag?
description_correct:

 tags are displayed in a fixed-width font, typically courier, and maintain both line breaks and spaces.
description_incorrect: That's wrong. The <pre> tag is used for special formatting in HTML.

question: Which of the following is the correct way to send mail in HTML?
description_correct: That's correct! To create a mailto link in HTML, you can use the <a> (anchor tag) with the href attribute set to "mailto:" followed by the email address.
description_incorrect: That's wrong. The correct way to create a mailto link in HTML is using the <a> tag with the href attribute set to "mailto:" followed by the email address.

question: Which of the following is the container for <tr>, <th>, and <td>?
description_correct: That's correct! The <table> tag in HTML is used to display data in a tabular format and serves as the container for <tr>, <th>, and <td> elements.
description_incorrect: That's wrong. The <table> tag is the container for rows (<tr>), header cells (<th>), and data cells (<td>) in HTML tables.

question: How to insert a background image in HTML?
description_correct: That's correct! To insert a background image for the entire HTML document, you can use the <body> tag with the background attribute set to the image file's path.
description_incorrect: That's wrong. To set a background image in HTML, you should use the <body> tag with the background attribute as shown: <body background="img.png">.

question: What are the types of unordered or bulleted list in HTML?
description_correct: That's correct! The types of unordered or bulleted lists in HTML are disc, circle, and square.
description_incorrect: That's wrong. The correct types of unordered or bulleted lists in HTML are disc, circle, and square.

question: Which of the following is the correct way to create a list using lowercase letters?
description_correct: That's correct! To create an ordered list (numbered list) using lowercase letters, you should use the <ol> tag with the type attribute set to "1".
description_incorrect: That's wrong. The correct way to create a numbered list using lowercase letters is by using the <ol> tag with the type attribute set to "1".

question: Which of the following is the correct way to start an ordered list with the count of numeric value 4?
description_correct: That's correct! To start an ordered list with a specific numeric value (in this case, 4), you can use the <ol> tag with the start attribute set to "4".
description_incorrect: That's wrong. To start an ordered list with a specific numeric value, you should use the <ol> tag with the start attribute as shown: <ol type="1" start="4">.

question: Which of the following HTML attribute is used to define inline styles?
description_correct: That's correct! The style attribute in HTML is used to change the style of existing HTML elements and apply inline styles.
description_incorrect: That's wrong. The style attribute in HTML is used to define inline styles for elements.

question: Which of the following is the paragraph tag in HTML?
description_correct:
That's correct! The

(paragraph tag) tag in HTML is used to define a paragraph in a webpage. It indicates the starting of a new paragraph.
description_incorrect:
That's wrong. The

tag is the paragraph tag in HTML.

question: An HTML program is saved by using the ____ extension.
description_correct: That's correct! An HTML program is typically saved with the .html or .htm extension.
description_incorrect: That's wrong. HTML programs are usually saved with the .html or .htm extension.

question: A program in HTML can be rendered and read by -
description_correct: That's correct! HTML programs can be rendered and read by web browsers. Web browsers interpret HTML and display web pages accordingly.
description_incorrect: That's wrong. HTML programs are rendered and read by web browsers, not servers or interpreters.

question: The tags in HTML are -
description_correct: That's correct! HTML tags are not case-sensitive, meaning they can be used in either uppercase or lowercase.
description_incorrect: That's wrong. HTML tags are not case-sensitive, so they can be used in either uppercase or lowercase.

question: Which of the following is the root tag of the HTML document?
description_correct: That's correct! The <html> tag represents the root of an HTML document and is called the root element. It contains other elements like <head>, <body>, and more.
description_incorrect: That's wrong. The <html> tag is the root of an HTML document, containing other elements like <head>, <body>, and more.

question: In HTML5, which of the following tag is used to initialize the document type?
description_correct: That's correct! In HTML5, the <!DOCTYPE html> tag is used to initialize the document type and inform the browser about the HTML version.
description_incorrect: That's wrong. In HTML5, you should use the <!DOCTYPE html> tag to initialize the document type.

question: Which of the following tag is used to create a combo box (or drop-down box)?
description_correct: That's correct! The <select> tag is used to create a combo box or drop-down box in HTML, allowing users to select from multiple options.
description_incorrect: That's wrong. To create a combo box or drop-down box in HTML, you should use the <select> tag.

question: Which of the following are the attributes of the <form> tag?
description_correct: That's correct! The <form> tag in HTML can have both 'method' and 'action' attributes to specify how the form data should be submitted.
description_incorrect: That's incorrect. The <form> tag can have both 'method' and 'action' attributes to specify how the form data should be submitted.

question: Which is the correct way to comment out something in HTML?
description_correct: That's correct! In HTML, you should use <!-- to start a comment and --> to end a comment. Anything between these markers will be treated as a comment and not displayed on the web page.
description_incorrect: That's incorrect. To comment out something in HTML, you should use <!-- to start a comment and --> to end a comment.

question: Which HTML tag is used to display the power in expression, i.e., (x^2 - y^2)?
description_correct: That's correct! The <sup> tag in HTML is used to display text as superscript, which is often used for mathematical expressions like (x^2 - y^2).
description_incorrect: That's incorrect. To display text as superscript for mathematical expressions, you should use the <sup> tag.

question: Which of the following is the correct way to change the font face in HTML?
description_correct: That's correct! To change the font face in HTML, you should use the <font> tag with the 'face' attribute like this: <font face='Calibri'>_____ </font>.
description_incorrect: That's incorrect. To change the font face in HTML, you should use the <font> tag with the 'face' attribute like this: <font face='Calibri'> ____ </font>.

question: In HTML, which attribute is used to create a link that opens in a new window tab?
description_correct: That's correct! The target="_blank" attribute in the Anchor tag is used to make a link open in a new window or tab.
description_incorrect: That's incorrect. To make a link open in a new window or tab, you should use the target="_blank" attribute in the Anchor tag.

question: Which HTML element is used for a short quote?
description_correct: That's correct! The <q> element in HTML is used for shorter quotes and is typically rendered with quotation marks around the content.
description_incorrect: That's incorrect. To represent a short quote in HTML, you should use the <q> element.

question: Which of the following HTML tags is used to create an unordered list?
description_correct: That's correct! The <ul> tag is used to create an unordered list in HTML, and by default, the list items are displayed with bullets.
description_incorrect: That's incorrect. To create an unordered list in HTML, you should use the <ul> tag.

question: Which HTML element is used for an abbreviation or acronym?
description_correct: That's correct! The <abbr> element in HTML is used for abbreviations or acronyms, and it allows you to specify a title for additional information.
description_incorrect: That's incorrect. To represent an abbreviation or acronym in HTML, you should use the <abbr> element.

question: Which of the following HTML tags is used to add a row in a table?
description_correct: That's correct! In HTML, the <tr> tag is used to create a row in a table.
description_incorrect: That's incorrect. To create a row in an HTML table, you should use the <tr> tag.

question: What is the purpose of the <address> element in HTML?

options.text: Contains contact details for the author

description_correct: That's correct! The <address> element in HTML is used to contain contact details for the author of a web page.
description_incorrect: That's incorrect. The <address> element in HTML is used to contain contact details for the author of a web page.

question: HTML is the standard ____ language for creating Web pages.
description_correct: Correct! HTML is indeed the standard markup language used for creating Web pages.
description_incorrect: Incorrect. The correct answer is D. HTML is the standard markup language for creating Web pages.

question: HTML stands for_______.
description_correct: That's right! HTML stands for 'Hyper Text Markup Language.'
description_incorrect: Oops, that's not correct. The answer is B. HTML stands for 'Hyper Text Markup Language.'

question: Which is the correct syntax to include a comment in an HTML document?
description_correct: Great job! You got it right. The correct syntax to include a comment in an HTML document is <!-- Comment -->.
description_incorrect: Not quite. The correct answer is D. You should use <!-- Comment --> to include comments in HTML.

question: Can we hide content using a comment?
description_correct: Absolutely! Comments can be used to hide content in HTML.
description_incorrect: Incorrect. You can indeed hide content using comments in HTML. The answer is A.

question: Can we hide inline content using a comment?
description_correct: Well done! You're correct. You can hide inline content using comments in HTML.
description_incorrect: Not quite. The answer is A. You can hide inline content using comments in HTML.
